accussed_details.name: Muhammad Aslam
allegation: Improper grant of land on Harap tenure

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Malik
allegation: Improper grant of land on Harap tenure

complaint_summary: Muhammad Rahim challenged the grant of land on Harap tenure to Muhammad Aslam and Muhammad Malik, citing improper eligibility and procedural errors.
investigation_summary: Evidence included certificates from X.E.N. Main Line Division and Headmaster of Government Primary School, Golarchi. Respondents failed to provide documentary proof of eligibility.
judgment_summary: The court upheld the appeal, set aside the Revenue Officer's order, and directed arrears with penal interest to be recovered from the appellant. The land was re-granted to Muhammad Rahim.
punishment: Arrears with penal interest to be recovered from Muhammad Rahim.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal allowed; land re-granted to appellant.
legal_arguments: Muhammad Rahim argued that the land was improperly granted to minors and non-Haris.
Respondents failed to prove eligibility under Harap tenure conditions.
assets: Land parcels B. No, 154/2, 3 and B. No, 153/2, 3

witness_statement.Muhammad Aslam: Admitted being a minor at the time of land grant.
witness_statement.Muhammad Malik: Failed to provide proof of eligibility under Harap tenure.

key_issues: Improper grant of land under Harap tenure.

legal_terms.Harap tenure: A type of land grant tenure requiring specific eligibility conditions.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the improper grant of land under Harap tenure to minors and non-Haris, leading to the appeal being allowed and the land re-granted to the appellant.
